\section*{Examples}

\paragraph{Example} Take $p = 1000000000100011$ and $q = 222222222222222221$ to be our two primes $p$, $q$. So $n = 222222222244446887666666666544431$ and $\phi(n) = (1000000000100011 - 1)(222222222222222221 - 1) = 222222222244446664444444444222200$.

We choose an integer $a$ relatively prime to $\phi(n) = 222222222244446664444444444222200$: Say $a = 139494862853911606524349744947323$. Express $1$ as a linear combination of $222222222244446664444444444222200$ and $139494862853911606524349744947323$:
$$119725983215366906541881876496587 \cdot 139494862853911606524349744947323 - 75155218231531710475272684277103 \cdot 222222222244446664444444444222200 = 1$$
so `$x$' is $119725983215366906541881876496587$. We publish $(n, a) = (222222222244446887666666666544431, 139494862853911606524349744947323)$.

To encode a block $\beta$, the sender calculates $\beta^{139494862853911606524349744947323} \mod 222222222244446887666666666544431$, and to decode a received block $m$, we calculate $m^{119725983215366906541881876496587} \mod 222222222244446887666666666544431$.

Thus, for example, to encode the message $\beta = 22$, the sender computes
$$22^{139494862853911606524349744947323} \mod 222222222244446887666666666544431 = 163644703763600866631298225238422 \mod 222222222244446887666666666544431$$
and so sends $m = 163644703763600866631298225238422$. On receipt of this message, anyone who knows `$x$' (the inverse of $139494862853911606524349744947323 \mod 222222222244446887666666666544431$) computes $163644703763600866631298225238422^{119725983215366906541881876496587} \mod 222222222244446887666666666544431$ which is equal to the original message $22$.

If now we use the number-to-letter equivalents:
\begin{center}
\begin{tabular}{ c c c c c c c }
R = 082, S = 083, T = 084, G = 071, I = 073, N = 078, O = 079, \\
\end{tabular}
\end{center}
and the received message is $69919240523854607121019630599125/139284243606001294924461865722675/129761740497411608977112018018483$, the original message is decoded by calculating
$$69919240523854607121019630599125^{119725983215366906541881876496587} \equiv 83084 \mod 222222222244446887666666666544431$$
and
$$139284243606001294924461865722675^{119725983215366906541881876496587} \equiv 82079 \mod 222222222244446887666666666544431$$
and
$$129761740497411608977112018018483^{119725983215366906541881876496587} \equiv 78071 \mod 222222222244446887666666666544431$$

Juxtaposing these blocks gives 083084082079078071, and so the message was the word S T R O N G.
